keyword: how many calories in half a chicken breast
title: How Many Calories in Half a Chicken Breast?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in half a chicken breast, including protein, fat, carbs, per-100g breakdown, and simple tweaks for your meal.
h1: How Many Calories in Half a Chicken Breast?
assumptions: Half of a standard 200g cooked, skinless, boneless chicken breast (i.e., 100g), roasted or grilled, no added oil or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by chicken size, cut, cooking method, and added ingredients; check labels or sources for precision.

quick_answer.text: Half a cooked, skinless chicken breast (about 100g) provides ~165 kcal and ~31 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil during cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in half a chicken breast?
faqs.a: About 165 kcal for half a 200g cooked, skinless breast (100g).

faqs.q: How much protein in half a chicken breast?
Does cooking method affect calories in chicken breast?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”grilling or baking keeps it low; frying or adding oil increases calories significantly.

faqs.q: What about carbs in half a chicken breast?
faqs.a: Plain chicken breast has 0 g carbs, making it ideal for low-carb diets.

faqs.q: How does chicken breast size impact calorie count?
faqs.a: A larger breast means more calories per half; values assume a standard 200g whole breast.
